intro: Hieracium subnudum var. foliosum, commonly known as the naked-stem hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial species belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. The variant 'foliosum' is distinguished by its reduced leaf structure compared to other varieties of Hieracium.
